intro: Porpax pusilla, commonly known as the dwarf porpax, is a small flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of less than 10 centimeters, making it a compact and delicate species. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its size and ornamental appearance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its visual interest.
